Keywords: tci sign aggressor direction baseline atomic
Best For: HFT baseline, minimal latency, aggressor detection
Interpretation: Instant direction signal, maximum noise, latency floor
Limitations: High variance no smoothing assumes all volume equal
Combine With: Any filter for comparison baseline Sharpe

Best For: Trend detection, crossovers, smoothing price series
Interpretation: Price above EMA = bullish, below = bearish, crossover = signal
Limitations: Lags price vulnerable in chop bar-dependent if not adapted

Best For: Slow trend, support/resistance levels, moving average crossovers
Interpretation: Support/resistance, direction of trend, crossing signals
Limitations: Heavy lag equal weight to old data sensitive to outliers

Keywords: rsi overbought oversold momentum oscillator wilder
Best For: Overbought/oversold conditions, divergence detection, mean reversion
Interpretation: RSI > 70 = overbought, < 30 = oversold, divergences predict reversals
Limitations: Fails in strong trends can stay extremebar size affects calculation

Formula/Description: MACD = EMA(12) - EMA(26), Signal = EMA(9) of MACD
Best For: Trend following, momentum shifts, divergence, crossover signals
Interpretation: MACD > Signal = bullish crossover, histogram expansion = momentum
Limitations: Lagging (triple EMA) whipsaws in ranging markets

Keywords: bollinger bands volatility squeeze breakout mean-reversion
Formula/Description: Upper = SMA + k·σ, Lower = SMA - k·σ
Best For: Volatility detection, overbought/oversold, squeeze/breakout setups
Interpretation: Price at band = extreme, squeeze = low vol (breakout pending), expansion = high vol
Limitations: Assumes normal distribution lags price

Best For: Volatility measurement, stop-loss placement, position scaling
Interpretation: Higher ATR = higher volatility, used to scale risk (stops, size)
Limitations: Non-directional (only magnitude) lags vol changes
Combine With: Stop-loss orders position sizing breakout filters

Keywords: stochastic overbought oversold momentum fast slow
Best For: Overbought/oversold, divergence, mean reversion in ranges
Parameters: K period (14), D period (3), Overbought (80), Oversold (20)
Interpretation: Above 80 = overbought, below 20 = oversold, K/D cross = signal
Limitations: Extreme in trends false signals bar-dependent

Keywords: adx directional-index trend-strength di+ di- wilder
Best For: Trend strength measurement, filter for trend-following strategies
Interpretation: ADX > 25 = strong trend, < 20 = weak/ranging, direction from DI+/DI-
Limitations: Does not indicate direction (only strength) lagging

Best For: Volume confirmation, divergence detection, accumulation/distribution
Interpretation: Rising OBV + rising price = bullish, divergence = reversal signal
Limitations: Ignores magnitude of price change noisy in low volume

Best For: Execution benchmark, institutional anchor, intraday mean reversion
Interpretation: Price above VWAP = bullish intraday, institutions use as fair value reference
Limitations: Resets daily (not multi-day) volume-dependent

Keywords: ichimoku cloud kijun tenkan senkou chikou japanese
Formula/Description: Multiple lines: Tenkan, Kijun, Senkou A/B (cloud), Chikou
Best For: Trend direction, support/resistance, momentum, complete system
Interpretation: Price in cloud = ranging, above cloud = bullish, below = bearish, thick cloud = strong S/R
Limitations: Complex (many components) lagging in fast markets

Keywords: fibonacci retracement golden-ratio support resistance levels
Best For: Support/resistance levels, retracement targets, confluence zones
Interpretation: Price bounces at Fib levels, 61.8% most significant, confluence with other levels = strong
Limitations: Subjective (swing selection) self-fulfilling

Formula/Description: PP = (H + L + C)/3, S1 = 2PP - H, R1 = 2PP - L, etc.
Time-Domain: Daily pivots (calculated from prior day OHLC)
Best For: Intraday S/R levels, day trading, floor trader levels
Interpretation: Price at pivot = key level, above = bullish, below = bearish, bounces common
Limitations: Static (prior day) less effective in trending days

Formula/Description: Histogram of volume by price, POC = highest volume price node
Best For: Fair value identification, high-probability S/R, auction market theory
Interpretation: POC = fair value, Value Area = 70% volume range, high-volume nodes = S/R
Limitations: Requires volume data lags (built from past) bar-dependent
Avoid For: Low volume instruments futures without volume

Keywords: mfi money-flow volume rsi overbought oversold
Best For: Volume-weighted RSI, divergence detection, overbought/oversold with volume
Interpretation: Similar to RSI but volume-weighted, > 80 = overbought, < 20 = oversold
Limitations: Requires volume data lags like RSI

Keywords: aroon up down crossover trend-strength time-based
Formula/Description: Aroon Up = (N - periods since N-high)/N·100, Aroon Down = similar for lows
Best For: Trend strength, directional changes, new high/low identification
Interpretation: Aroon Up > 70 = strong uptrend, Down > 70 = downtrend, cross = reversal
Limitations: Time-based (not price-based) lags

Keywords: cci commodity-channel momentum overbought oversold deviation
Best For: Overbought/oversold, trend detection, divergence in commodities
Interpretation: CCI > +100 = overbought, < -100 = oversold, extreme readings in trends
Limitations: Designed for commodities unbounded can stay extreme

Best For: Fast overbought/oversold, similar to Stochastic, short-term reversals
Interpretation: Above -20 = overbought, below -80 = oversold, fast signals
Limitations: Very sensitive whipsaws in chop

Keywords: keltner channels atr volatility bands trend envelope
Formula/Description: Middle = EMA(C), Upper = EMA + k·ATR, Lower = EMA - k·ATR
Best For: Trend-following, breakout detection, volatility envelope
Parameters: EMA period (20), ATR period (10), Multiplier k (2)
Interpretation: Price at channel = extreme, breakout above = bullish trend, below = bearish
Limitations: ATR-based (lags volatility) EMA lag

Formula/Description: SAR updates based on Extreme Point and Acceleration Factor
Best For: max 0.2)
Interpretation: Initial AF (0.02), Max AF (0.2), Step (0.02)
Limitations: Dots below price = uptrend, above = downtrend, dot flip = reversal signal
Combine With: Whipsaws in ranges late exits in fast moves

Best For: Accumulation/distribution, volume pressure, divergence
Interpretation: CMF > 0 = buying pressure, < 0 = selling pressure, divergence = reversal
Limitations: Lags smoothed over period volume-dependent

Formula/Description: Upper = Highest High(N), Lower = Lowest Low(N)
Best For: Breakout strategies, trend-following, Turtle Traders system
Interpretation: Breakout above upper = buy signal, below lower = sell signal, original Turtle system
Limitations: Lags (uses historical extremes) whipsaws
Combine With: ATR for stops momentum confirmation volume
